courses.title: Mathematics
courses.description: This course will introduce students to algebra and trigonometry

courses.subject: ENG
courses.title: English Language
courses.description: This course introduces students to essay writing, grammar, lexis and pronunciation.

courses.subject: PHY
courses.title: Physics
courses.description: This course introduces students to the laws of nature and its application

courses.subject: HIS

courses.description: This course will focus on local and international history

courses.subject: CMM
courses.title: Commerce
courses.description: This course exposes students to the financial system and its principles

courses.subject: CHM
courses.title: Chemistry
courses.description: This course introduces students to properties and effects of elements and their manipulation.

courses.subject: BUS
courses.title: Business Studies
courses.description: This course deals with the various aspects of business management, such as finance, marketing, human resources and production.

courses.subject: BIO
courses.title: Biology
courses.description: Biology is a natural science discipline that studies living things.

courses.subject: FMH

courses.description: This course dives deeper into some mathematical applications in life.

courses.subject: GOV
courses.title: Government
courses.description: This course introduces students to institutions and how they are run.

courses.subject: REL
courses.title: Religious Studies
courses.description: This course exposes students to spiritual foundations and beliefs.

courses.subject: CED
courses.title: Civic Education
courses.description: Civic Education provides information and learning experiences to equip and empower students to participate in democratic processes.

courses.subject: AGS
courses.title: Agricultural Science
courses.description: This course exposes students to the world of farming including livestock, crop farming, mechanization as well as guding principles
